lines.text: Oh no, not again! You know, a man can get awful tired of bein' shot at.
Are you looking for a medal?
No, I got one.
I bet you would have traded it for a meal after the surrender.
How'd you guess?
Oh, I fought against you rebels... all guts and no sense.
I figured you for a good soldier. I should have known better. Good soldiers never volunteer.
[pointing to Jim Slater's holster]
I notice you use a tie-down. Does that mean you're fast? Everybody west of the Pecos thinks that they're fast.
You know, I've never seen it fail. When you take a trigger-happy bunch sitting it out like this, somebody's bound to start fooling with his gun.
[the Sheriff warns Jim about the brothers of a murderous Deputy Sheriff Jim killed in self-defense]
When they hear about this, they're going to come looking for you.
Seems logical.
If it's your idea to shoot it out with them, you're going to lose.
Could be.
And even if you beat 'em, you're going to lose... because I'm going to hang the man that wins.
You're going to talk and I'm going to listen.
If this is a holdup, you're dead.
If I did it this way, I'd deserve to be.
What's on your mind?
I've spent six months looking for a killer. What do you do when he turns out to be your father?
Killer? Aren't you a little careless with your words, son? Yes, I kill when I have to. But I've never killed a man who wasn't trying to kill me. And that goes for the Sheriff in spite of his badge.
There's things a man has to know and has to do, and it's best that he does them alone.
